# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/darwin-arm64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/urllib3/util/queue.py
@source-hash: 9d1817f3f797fbf5
@generated: 2026-02-09T17:57:26Z

## Purpose
Implements a Last-In-First-Out (LIFO) queue data structure by extending Python's standard queue.Queue class. Part of urllib3's utility modules for connection pooling and request management.

## Key Components

### LifoQueue Class (L11-22)
- **Purpose**: Thread-safe LIFO queue implementation using collections.deque as backing storage
- **Inheritance**: Extends `queue.Queue` to leverage built-in threading primitives and blocking behavior
- **Use Case**: Optimal for connection pooling where most recently used connections should be reused first

### Core Methods
- **`_init(self, _)` (L12-13)**: Initializes internal queue as collections.deque, ignoring maxsize parameter
- **`_qsize(self, len=len)` (L15-16)**: Returns queue size using local len reference for performance
- **`_put(self, item)` (L18-19)**: Adds item to right end of deque (append operation)
- **`_get(self)` (L21-22)**: Removes and returns item from right end of deque (pop operation)

## Dependencies
- **collections**: Standard library for deque implementation
- **six**: Python 2/3 compatibility layer (L3)
- **queue**: Standard library queue module via six.moves (L4)

## Architecture Notes
- Uses deque's append/pop operations to achieve LIFO behavior efficiently
- Inherits thread safety, blocking, and timeout capabilities from parent Queue class
- Python 2 compatibility maintained through conditional Queue import (L6-8)
- Performance optimization: local len binding in _qsize method signature

## Critical Behavior
- LIFO semantics: last item added is first item retrieved
- Thread-safe operations inherited from queue.Queue
- No size limit enforcement in _init (maxsize parameter ignored)
